text: hey joseline with Walter's world and we
are just wrapping up a two-week trip
through Iceland and it has been an
incredible journey with the kids and so
I wanted to do a little video on things
to see and do with your kids in Iceland
we did two weeks driving the entire
circle so we kind of hit a little bit of
everything we have seen glaciers
waterfalls icebergs and feed baby birds
that had been rescued on the Westman
Islands out we have hiked lava fields
and gorges and we we watched whales we
have seen shipwreck we have we've gone
first back riding this is like nature's
Disneyland it's just incredible for kids
there's so much to do in the sea there's
a lot of Education but it's also just a
lot of fun you just stop somewhere get
out and start hiking for an hour or two
when they're tired get back in the car
they sleep and you drive to the next
place it's been awesome Iceland is also
really family-friendly kids eat for free
almost every guest house that we stayed
at the kids got free breakfasts if they
didn't have free breakfast it was it was
half-price but there are some things
that you should know about coming to
Iceland even in the winter it's the end
of July now and I don't know it's windy
so you kind of got a pat fur for winter
weather
we brought boots for the kids we ended
up buying jackets here because I thought
that puffy vests and a couple layers of
long sleeves would be enough it wasn't
so we ended up buying jackets here which
will end up being their winter jackets
but be prepared for that museums are
typically free for kids usually
under the age of 18 but some are like 12
and under and there's always a discount
if it's not free for the kids everyone
here speaks really great English we
haven't had problems I mean even in the
furthest reaches of the country everyone
spoke English and they were really great
with our kids
so most towns have swimming pools even
like little villages of like 200 people
will have swimming pools with great
water slides and they're all heated and
there's no chlorine and it's not salt
water and it's really easy on kids skin
they're also geothermal hot pots
throughout the country like the Blue
Lagoon
for instance and we took the kids to a
couple of them and they absolutely loved
it it's like swimming in a giant hot tub
and it's so much fun they really enjoyed
that when you go to the Westman Islands
which you absolutely have to do if you
have kids they have an aquarium slash
bird sanctuary where they rescue
different birds but they have a puffin
that lives there he had been rescued and
the kids got to hold him and pet him and
they got to feed little tiny baby birds
and it was just such a great experience
it's something you would never get to do
anywhere else so one thing you have to
know to get around Iceland if you're
gonna leave recchia Veck at all you're
gonna have to rent a car and you're
gonna do some heavy-duty driving I mean
most places are only three to four hours
apart but some of the driving is pretty
pretty insane like gravel mountain roads
and crossing fjords that are covered in
clouds so your kids have to be aware
that there are times when they have to
be just absolutely silence you can get
through things quickly one of the things
that we had our kids do was play the
waterfall game
Waterfalls throughout the whole country
I have no idea how many hundreds of her
finally up - some are close to probably
300 but it was a really fun game kept
them going kept them occupied while we
were trying to drive so with the car
stuff make sure that you bring your car
seats we actually have our car seats on
something called baby go-go's and there
are just wheels and a telescoping handle
that that attaches so we can just drag
the kids and/or their car seats around
with us through airports and stuff it
makes traveling with a car seat so much
easier than lugging those big huge heavy
things around but you'll need those
you'll need you know just the regular
games and stuff you can watch my video
on what to pack in a kids backpack to
keep them occupied so pretty much all
the outdoor activities that parents can
do like kayaking horseback riding and
hiking and whatnot they have versions
for kids or you can just sort of make up
your own version and go Trek out on your
own something easy for the kids to do to
go whale watching you want to go to
husavik and a Carrera they're both up in
the north we ended up going just to echo
reality for times sake
but we spent three hours on the boat and
we probably watched whales for two hours
of that and it was just incredible the
kids loved every minute of it
Iceland is super safe they have a really
really low crime rate and what crime
there is is just like
or things like that we have felt welcome
and comfortable and completely at ease
everywhere we've been in this country so
as you drive there aren't necessarily a

want to pack up some snacks like when
you leave Reykjavik after you get on the

just have snacks and juice boxes and
things in the car for the kids because
there aren't a lot of places to stop
recce avec is the largest city and it's
about 300,000 in the metro area and the
second city is a curie and it's only
17,000 i think so
everything else you see is gonna be
pretty small and there it's limited
options sometimes for food and drink and
things like that
speaking of food our kids went crazy
eating fresh trout and salmon
they love the fish there's lots of fish
and lamb and skier scares this wonderful
yogurt it's sort of like a Greek yogurt
it's it's strange yogurt and it's
wonderful the kids are like I think
we've eaten at least twice a day every
day that we've been here something you
really need to be aware of when you're
traveling through Iceland in the summer
is that it's almost 24 hours of light
the Sun sets at like 12:00 12:15 at
night and it comes up at like 3:00 3:30
in the mornings so you kind of just get
some Twilight so blackout curtains are
helpful but you may need it like masks
or something to keep your kids asleep
God knows our kids haven't been to sleep
before midnight and he night we've been
here so sleep is a little bit difficult
with all of them with all the light it's
kind of its kind of tough in the fall in
the spring you're more likely to have a

Northern Lights which would be amazing
to see the
they would just it's you know nature's
light show it would be awesome but you

so you know you might not be able to see
